item.title: Ellen add a quote by Sean O'Casey
item.description: "When it was dark, you always carried the sun in your hand for me." -- Sean O'Casey

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Ellen add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Osip Mandelstam
item.description: "My turn shall also come: I sense the spreading of a wing." -- Osip Mandelstam

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we now know and understand, while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Brian Weiss
item.description: "For truly we are all angels temporarily hiding as humans." -- Brian Weiss

item.title: Ellen add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Cut out all these exclamation points. An exclamation point is like laughing at your own joke." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Erma Bombeck
Ellen add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart." -- Confucius

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I'm not strange, weird, off, nor crazy, my reality is just different from yours." -- Lewis Carroll
